metadata.name: Russell's World Briefing
metadata.description: Daily international news briefing — all bullets, ready by 6am ET

all.headline: Russia Nears Capture of Key Ukrainian Towns After Year of Grinding Assaults
all.description: Russian troops have advanced at a glacial pace in recent months, but gains in southern and eastern Ukraine could give Moscow an edge in U.S.-mediated peace talks.

all.headline: Trump’s Threats to Cuba’s Oil Suppliers Put Mexico in a Bind
all.description: The longstanding alliance between Cuba and Mexico is under mounting pressure from the United States, forcing President Claudia Sheinbaum into a precarious balancing act.

all.headline: The Ties That Bound the UK’s ‘Prince of Darkness’ Peter Mandelson to Jeffrey Epstein
all.description: For years Peter Mandelson, a senior British politician, concealed the depth of his friendship with the convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, until new files were released.

all.headline: How the Israeli President’s Visit to Australia Created a ‘Tinder Box’
all.description: Isaac Herzog’s trip led to widespread rallies and tested the restrictions on protests that Australia installed after a deadly attack on a Jewish celebration.

all.headline: How Italy’s Police and Army Compete to Enlist Italian Olympians
all.description: Most Italian athletes at the Winter Games subsidize their training by joining the police or the military, which vie to enlist the best talent.

all.headline: Hamas Would Keep Some Weapons Initially in Draft Gaza Plan
all.description: Israel is unlikely to withdraw its troops from the enclave before Hamas and other militant groups lay down their arms.

all.headline: Russia Knocked Out the Heat. So She Slept in a Tent on Her Bed.
all.description: With defiant ingenuity, Kyiv residents are trying to find ways to stay warm in a cruel winter.

all.headline: What to Know About Canada’s New Bridge to the U.S. That Trump Hates
all.description: President Trump’s threat to block the opening of the new crossing is the latest in a long string of challenges for the project.

all.headline: Israelis Protest Surge in Gun Crime Within Arab Community
all.description: Palestinian and Jewish citizens of Israel joined forces to demand government action in the face of a spiraling death toll from criminal violence among Arabs.

all.headline: Olympic Officials Ban Ukrainian’s Helmet Honoring War Dead
all.description: Vladyslav Heraskevych said he would risk disqualification to wear a helmet that the International Olympic Committee said defied a ban on political speech.

all.headline: Eating Kosher in the Heart of Syria: Lamb-Stuffed Zucchini but Hold the Yogurt
all.description: In the post-Assad era, more Jews are visiting a country that some fled decades ago. One hotel restaurant offers a corner where religious dietary requirements are melded with the local cuisine.

all.headline: A Shift in Chinese Taste for Durian Throws Malaysian Farmers Into Turmoil
all.description: Malaysian durian farmers saw immense profits over the last decade as China snapped up their produce. But tastes have shifted.

all.headline: Italy’s Top Sports Journalists Plan to Strike Over Anchor’s Olympics Gaffes
all.description: Paolo Petrecca made numerous gaffes while commentating on the Olympics opening ceremonies for Italy’s public broadcaster. Journalists are incensed.

all.headline: After M23 Takeover, Goma Carries Violent Memories and Signs of Hope
all.description: A year after a rebel takeover, residents of Goma, in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo, carry violent memories and signs of hope.

all.headline: Mexican Cartel’s Seized Ammunition Is Traced to U.S. Army Plant
all.description: About 137,000 .50-caliber rounds have been seized since 2012, and of those, 47 percent came from a plant in Kansas City, Mo., Mexico’s defense secretary said.
